title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [15–19 december 1868]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [15–19 December 1868]
text: My dear Waltalthough i have had a pretty hard day yet i felt as if i wanted to write a line before i went to bed although i am very tired indeed well Walt Jeffy and mattyMatty has started to night for st louLou isSt. Louis they are to stop to pittsburghPittsburgh for a day and a night mattyMatty was about the same she cantcan't doodo much as soon as she does any thing in the way of housework she vomits up all she eats she is far from well but the doctor speaks encouragelyencouragingly of her but O waltWalt haint i had a seigesiege they pretended to live up stairs but the provitionsprovisions was prepared down well Walter dear i have lived through it) but some things i have thought rather hard of they have never paid a cent of rent nor a cent of gassgas bill nor give me a dollar when they went away they gave me an allapaccaalpaca dress when they first came and Jeff bought me a little mite of a castor that is all about three weeks ago georgeGeorge bought 20lb of butter and they have used out off it ever since and mattyMatty borrowed 50 dollars of georgeGeorge but jeffyJeffy didentdidn't settle it) they had plenty of money as jeffyJeffy drawed that out off the bank i did really think they had ought to give me some but let eveyevery thing go but i would ask more than 100 dl to go through the same again) burn this letterwell waltWalt i dontdon't hear any more from heydeHeyde the letter i sent to you was the last i got poor han i feel very bad about her itsit's hard to know what to doodo as heydeHeyde seems to be determined none of the family shall come on there i got your letter walterWalter dear with the doctors on tuesdayTuesday all rightDr enos is dead i suppose you see in the papers very suddenlymy love to all the OconorsO'Connors and keep a share for yourselfgeorgeGeorge has commenced his house they are digging the cellarJeff & Matt just gone back to St Louis after some weeks stay in Brooklyn.George's house just begun.It is about middle Dec. 1868 Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [15–19 December 1868]
